1.title: Hue
1.text: Hue describes what we typically think of as the color of an object, for instance ''blue'', ''red'', ''purple'' etc. Hue can be represented as a color's position on a standard color wheel. Adding white, black or grey will not change a color's hue.

media.description: The color wheel. Each position represents a different hue.
Different colors with the same hue.

2.title: Hue
2.text: Pure hues are hues without any black, white or grey added. When used sparingly, pure hues can give a playful feel to a composition, or draw the eye in interesting ways.

media.caption: Photograph by Fred Herzog
media.description: The pure red hue in this photograph makes a strong impact when paired with the surrounding muted colors.

media.caption: Cover art for Never Mind the Bollocks here's the Sex Pistols by Sex Pistols
media.description: Pure hues give this album design a fun a playful feel.
media.alt: Cover art for Never Mind the Bollocks here's the Sex Pistols

3.title: Hue
3.text: However, pure hues can easily become overwhelming and unpleasant, especially if they are far apart on the color wheel.

media.description: Too many pure hues can create a clashing effect

media.caption: The Night Cafe by Vincent Van Gogh
media.description: This painting uses bright clashing hues to create an intentionally unsettling effect.
media.alt: The Night Cafe by Vincent Van Gogh

1.question_text: Select the pure hues that best represents the colors in the following image

options.explanation: The blue in this image is different.
There are no red hues in this image.
The orange has the same hue as the pole and the blue has the same hue as the background wall.

2.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a hue seen in this image

options.explanation: There is a small orange section in this painting
This pure green has the same hue as the background of this painting
Purple does not appear in this painting
This blue hue is featured prominently in this painting

3.question_text: Which of the following pairs has the same hue?

options.explanation: While we might call both of these colors blue, they have different hues. The left color is more of a true blue, while the right color is turquoise.
Both of these colors have the same red hue.
These colors have different hues.

1.title: Shade
1.text: A shade is a hue with black added to it. Colloquially, shade is used to refer to any variance of a hue, but in color terminology shade only refers to variations achieved by adding black.

media.description: Shades of green

2.title: Shade
2.text: When used prominently, shades can create a dark, moody effect

media.caption: Still frame from The Favorite directed by Yorgos Lanthimos
Dos Viejos Comiendo Sopa by Francisco Goya
media.alt: Dos viejos comiendo sopa painting by Francisco Goya

1.question_text: Which of the following is a shade of the hue shown

options.explanation: The color is obtained by adding white to the hue, shades are obtained by adding black.
This color has a different hue.
This color is obtained by adding black to the hue.

2.question_text: Which of the following 2 images most prominently features shades

options.caption: Blade Runner 2049 directed by Denis Villeneuve.
options.explanation: The predominently dark colors in this image are shades.
Shades are dark, the colors in this image are primarily light.

3.question_text: Select the pair where one color is a shade of the other.

options.explanation: These are 2 different hues
These colors are obtained by adding white to a blue hue. Shades are obtained by adding black to a color.
The color on the right is a shade of the color on the left.

1.title: Tint
1.text: A tint is a hue with white added to it. Tints are often colloquially referred to as ''pastel'' colors.

media.description: Tints of red

2.title: Tint
2.text: When used prominently, tints can create a lighter, brighter feel or a vintage effect, as if the color has faded over time.

media.caption: On the Cliffs by Helen McNicoll.
media.description: The tints in this painting give the sceen a light, calming effect.
media.alt: On the cliffs by Helen McNicoll

media.caption: Cover art for Goodbye Yellow Brick Road by Elton John
media.description: Tints in this album cover design give it a vintage feel.

1.question_text: Select the pair where one color is a tint of the other.

options.explanation: The color on the right is a tint of the hue on the left.
These colors are both tints of different hues.
The color on the left is a shade of the hue on the right.

2.question_text: Which of the following 2 images most prominently features tints

options.caption: Painting by Claude Monet
options.explanation: The colors in this painting are primarily tints.

options.caption: Painting by Mark Rothko
options.explanation: The vibrant colors in this painting are more accurately characterized as pure hues.

3.question_text: Which of the colors taken from the following image is a tint?

options.explanation: This color is a shade.
This color is a tint.
This color is a pure hue.

1.title: Tone
1.text: A tone is a hue with grey added to it. Tones typically appear more dull and muted than pure hues, tints or shades.

media.caption: Frame from the film Victoria
media.description: This frame is entirely composed of tones of the same blue hue.

2.title: Tone
2.text: Adding grey to different hues brings them closer together. Therefore tones can be used to make a color palette more harmonious.

media.caption: Sunrise by Claude Monet
media.description: The bright orange accent color stands out and does not clash against the muted blue tones of the background

1.question_text: Which of the following is a tone of the hue shown

options.explanation: This is a tone of blue.
This is a tint of blue.
This is a shade of blue.

2.question_text: Which of the colors taken from the following image is a tone?

options.explanation: This color is a tint of yellow.
This color is a pure hue.
This color is a tone of blue.

3.question_text: Which of the following 2 images most prominently features tones

options.caption: Christina's World by Andrew Wyeth
options.explanation: The muted colors in this image are tones

options.caption: Frame from the film Suspiria
options.explanation: The colors in this image are too bright to be tones.

1.title: Value
1.text: Value refers to how light/dark a color is. Lighter colors have higher value, darker colors have lower value. For a given hue, shades have lower value and tints have higher value.

media.description: Value scale for blue.

2.title: Value
2.text: Some pure hues have higher value than others. For instance, yellow has a higher value than blue. We can see this by comparing the colors when converted to black and white.

media.description: Pure yellow and blue hues compared to their equivalent greyscale values.
media.alt: Pure yellow and blue and their equivalent greyscale values.

1.question_text: Select the image that has lower value

options.caption: Still frame from Arrival directed by Denis Villeneuve.
options.explanation: The colors in this image are darker.

options.caption: Cover art for True Blue by Madonna
options.explanation: The colors in this image are lighter than the other.

2.question_text: Select the color with the highest value

options.explanation: This color has the lowest value.
This color has the highest value.
This color has the second highest value.
This color has the second lowest value.

3.question_text: Select the image with higher value

options.caption: Cover art for Sweetener by Ariana Grande
options.explanation: Most of the colors in this image have relatively high value.

options.caption: Still frame from The Dark Knight directed by Christopher Nolan.
options.explanation: The colors in this image are darker.

1.title: Chroma/Saturation
1.text: Chroma or saturation refers to how pure a color appears. Adding black, white or grey to a color lowers its chroma. In some contexts, chroma and saturation have slightly different meanings, but for our purposes we will consider them synonyms. Pure hues are the most saturated, while blacks, whites and greys are the least saturated.

media.alt: example of high chroma vs. low chroma

2.title: Chroma/Saturation
2.text: Colors with low chroma appear closer together, even if they have very different hues. Therefore lowering the chroma of a color palette can make it feel more harmonious. However, it can also make it feel more dull and reduce contrast.

media.description: These palettes have the same pure hues.

3.title: Chroma/Saturation
3.text: Kids movies often use highly saturated colors to give a bright, fun energy. Additionally, when paired with moody shades, highly satured colors can create a dark, futuristic city feel.

media.caption: Frame from the film Luca
media.description: Pixar's Luca uses highly saturated colors to give the film a fun, playful aesthetic.

media.caption: Still frame from Blade Runner 2049 directed by Denis Villeneuve.
media.description: Saturated neon colors against a dark background in Blade Runner 2049 set the scene of a futuristic cityscape.
media.alt: Still frame from Blade Runner 2049 directed by Denis Villeneuve

4.title: Chroma/Saturation
4.text: Low saturation/chroma can give a vintage or muted/melancholy feel

media.caption: Cover art for 1989 by Taylor Swift
media.description: Low chroma in the cover art for 1989 helps the image look like a vintage polariod.
media.alt: Cover art for 1989 by Taylor Swift

media.caption: Photograph by Ferran Moya
media.description: The muted colors in this photograph create a gloomy look.

1.question_text: Which of the following images is the best example of high chroma/saturation?

options.caption: Still frame from Dune directed by Denis Villeneuve.
options.explanation: The colors in this image have overall low chroma/saturation.

options.caption: Painting by Joan Miró
options.explanation: The blue and red in this painting have high chroma/saturation.

2.question_text: Which of the following images is the best example of low chroma/saturation?

options.caption: Still frame from Blade Runner 2049 directed by Denis Villeneuve.
options.explanation: The pinks and blues in this image have high chroma.

options.caption: Cover art for Season of Glass by Yoko Ono
options.explanation: The colors in this image are very muted and therefore have low chroma/saturation.

3.question_text: Select the color palette with the lowest chroma

options.explanation: This palette has high chroma.
Some colors in this palette have high chroma, some colors have low chroma.
This palette is the least saturated overall.

1.title: Contrast
1.text: Contrast is a measure of how distinct colors are . High contrast colors are very different, while low contrast colors are very similar. Contrast can be achieved through both hue and value.

media.caption: Frame from the film The White Ribbon
media.description: An example of high value contrast.
media.alt: Frame from the film The White Ribbon

media.caption: Frame from Pixar's Finding Dory
media.description: An example of high hue contrast. The bright orange and yellow contrast against the blue hues.

2.title: Contrast
2.text: Very high contrast images can create a jarring, striking effect.

media.caption: Frame from the film The Lighthouse
media.alt: Frame from the film The Lighthouse

3.title: Contrast
3.text: Low contrast images can create a hazy feel.

media.caption: Still frame from Blade Runner 2049 directed by Denis Villeneuve.

1.question_text: Select the image with higher contrast

options.caption: Cover art for The Fame Monster by Lady Gaga
options.explanation: The colors in this image have very different value.

options.caption: Painting by Mark Rothko
options.explanation: The colors in this image have similar hue and value and are therefore low contrast.

2.question_text: The following image is an example of:

options.text: High hue contrast and high value contrast
options.explanation: The hues do not have high contrast

options.text: Low hue contrast and low value contrast
options.explanation: The black and white background has high value contrast

options.text: High hue contrast and low value contrast
options.explanation: The hues do not have high contrast, the background has high value contrast.

options.text: Low hue contrast and high value contrast
options.explanation: The hues do not have high contrast, but the black and white background has high value contrast.

3.question_text: Select the image with lower constrast

options.caption: Still frame from 2001: A Space Odyssey directed by Stanley Kubrick.
options.explanation: This frame has relatively high contrast

options.caption: Still frame from 2001: A Space Odyssey directed by Stanley Kubrick.
options.explanation: This frame has relatively low contrast.

Neither of these paintings prominently feature tints
